title: How to Curl Eyelashes with a Spoon

steps.title: Heat a teaspoon in a glass of warm water for 3 minutes.
steps.content: Heat a teaspoon in a glass of warm water for 3 minutes. Fill a glass halfway with warm water, and place the clean metal teaspoon in head-down. Leave the spoon to heat up for 3 minutes. [1] X Research source Avoid using a large spoon as this will make it harder to press the lashes against the spoon.

steps.title: Dry the spoon.
steps.content: Dry the spoon. Remove the spoon from the water and dry it with a clean cloth. Wet lashes won't form or hold a curl well. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Hold the inside of the spoon over your eyelid.
steps.content: Hold the inside of the spoon over your eyelid. Hold the spoon horizontally and press the inside of the curve against your eyelid. [3] X Research source The rounded outside face of the spoon will be used to curl your lashes. [4] X Expert Source Erica Coates Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 8 April 2022. Check the temperature of the spoon on your wrist before bringing it up to your eye. If it feels uncomfortably hot on your wrist, allow it to cool for a minute.

steps.title: Press the top lashes against the spoon for 10 seconds.
steps.content: Press the top lashes against the spoon for 10 seconds. Pull the top lashes back against the curve of the spoon using your fingertips. Hold the base of the top lashes against the outside face of the spoon for 10 seconds to help set the curls. The curve of the heated spoon will help to set the top lashes into a curled position. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Check for any lashes that haven’t curled well.
steps.content: Check for any lashes that haven’t curled well. Look in the mirror to see if any of the lashes haven’t curled properly. The lashes on the corners of the eyes don’t always curl well on the initial curling. Repeat the curling process but concentrate on holding the remaining straight lashes against the spoon. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Sweep the mascara from the bottom to the top of your lashes.
steps.content: Sweep the mascara from the bottom to the top of your lashes. Stand in front of a mirror and look straight ahead. Bring the mascara brush to the roots of your top lashes and sweep the brush up, following the curve of your lashes. [7] X Expert Source Erica Coates Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 8 April 2022. The mascara will help to set your curls in place. [8] X Research source If you accidentally get any mascara in your eye, liberally use water to rinse your eye.

steps.title: Apply a second coat if you want a fuller look.
steps.content: Apply a second coat if you want a fuller look. Sweep the brush over your lashes again, follow the same process as for the first coat. The second coat of mascara will coat any lashes that were missed in the first application and will make your lashes look fuller. [9] X Research source If you prefer a more natural, thinner lash, skip the second layer. If you’re wanting an even fuller look, apply a third layer.

steps.title: Coat your bottom lashes with mascara.
steps.content: Coat your bottom lashes with mascara. Tilt your chin towards your body to stop the mascara marking your under-eyes. Sweep the mascara brush over the top of the bottom lashes. Coating your bottom lashes will help make your top lashes look more natural. If you find that mascara is getting on your cheeks, hold a small piece of paper over the area that gets marked while you apply the mascara. [10] X Research source
